node.title: Masks off but QR codes to stay as NSW COVID-19 restrictions tweaked
node.alt: Close up of a blue mask being taken off someone's face.
node.description: The NSW government updates the roadmap for easing COVID-19 restrictions after the state reaches the 95 per cent double-dose vaccination target or December 15, whichever comes first.Â
node.content: ["Mandatory mask rules in NSW will be largely scrapped next month under the state's updated roadmap for easing COVID-19 restrictions.", "Under new rules announced on Thursday masks would only be required on public transport, plans, at airports and for unvaccinated front-of-house hospitality staff.", "QR code check-ins will also be scaled back to only high-risk settings such as hospitals, aged and disability care facilities, gyms, places of worship, funerals, beauty venues.", "Check-ins will remain at pubs, bars, registered clubs and nightclubs and for indoor music festivals with more than 1000 patrons.", "The NSW government said the adjustments\u00a0would come into effect\u00a0after the state reached\u00a0the 95 per cent double-dose vaccination target or December 15, whichever comes first.\u00a0", "Adjustments to previous settings scheduled for this milestone include:\u00a0", "In NSW, 94.4 per cent of people aged 16 and over have had one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, and 92.1 per cent are fully inoculated.\u00a0", "More to come"]
